Text.Value: I'll be damned.
As the Absolute wills. We'll wait.
Forgive me True Soul, but what we want is to get to Moonrise as quickly as we can.
The Weaver's servant. Abhorrent - and captivating.
I've other business to take care of first. Wait here.
Connect to the divine spark within you. Channel it - your magic a call, a beacon.
What do you suggest? I've never known him to respond to anything else.
Forget the lyre - your guide will answer to a True Soul.
Pluck a tune.
No need for the lyre. I'll call this guide myself.
I have a lyre. It used to belong to a drow.
Watching gods... there is no boot big enough.
If the Nightwarden did not send you, who did? What are you doing here?
No need for the lyre. I'll summon the guide myself.
Ain't like we got much choice, is it?
Reach out with your powers to summon the guide.
*A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*
I hear them, my Queen, but not your music. I await that sweet, sweet sound.
Of course, you are free to take your chances if you wish. But I will be waiting here for the Nightwarden's lyre.
We are ready when you are, True Soul. We need only the lyre.

EditorData.NodeContext: Fixed smile and subservient - impatient but trying not to show it

Text.Value: Channel the power of your oath, making it a call - a beacon.
I do have this lyre, if it's any help?
True Soul. An honour.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bows their head slightly. This is their first time meeting a revered true soul

Text.Value: Unless someone swiped it.
Pluck a suitable tune.
Take out the lyre and start to play.
Wait here. I'll return.
No need for the lyre. I'll summon the guide myself.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player starts to play a tune on the spider harp

Text.Value: *Your rage echoes throughout the darkness - and it makes a connection. Something notices you.*
Just passing through, really.
If you want a tune, I know plenty.
*Your music echoes through the darkness - and it makes a connection. Something notices you.*
This land is weak, primed to be preyed upon.
You treacherous dog!
Wha'?
But sooner's better, yeah?
Ah, you do have it!
Yes. We will stay. We will wait.
New flesh for you, my queen. But, who are they?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The DRIDER ignores the Half-Orc and scuttles over to the player, leering down at them.
EditorData.NodeContext: The DRIDER ignores the Half-Orc and scuttles over to the player, leering down at them.

Text.Value: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*
Of course, we await your pleasure.
Reach out with your powers to summon the guide.
I'm not ready to summon the guide just yet.
Forgive me True Soul, we are simply eager to reach Moonrise as soon as we can.

EditorData.logicalname: Alias (LOGIC - Summon drider and start inclusion)

Text.Value: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*
*The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*
*Your power echoes through the darkness - and makes a connection. Something notices you.*
And where can I find this lyre?
*Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*
And where's this lyre again?
We've no need of magic strings. I will summon the guide myself.
Yes, I hear them, your majesty. Calling us. Their god and their guide, together.
Your lyre, mistress! What are they doing to it?

EditorData.NodeContext: A voice from the darkness - the drider hears you playing the harp badly

Text.Value: I seek my old home - for that I must pass through to Baldur's Gate.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player plays a tune on the spider harp, poorly

Text.Value: Open your mouth and ROAR - your anger a call. A summons.
Good, we were told to expect you.
Reach out with your powers to summon the guide.
We were told to expect a True Soul - that Nightwarden Minthara would send someone with her lyre to summon a guide through the darkness.
...Best introduce yourself. Perhaps he'll listen to a True Soul.

EditorData.NodeContext: talking to the player - deflated because you were ignored by another NPC who prefers to talk to the player

Text.Value: Why do you need a lyre, exactly?
Open your font of magic, let it pour forth as a beacon.
What, planning to sing instead?
The lyre, True Soul? It will summon our guide.

EditorData.NodeContext: Now a little irritated and impatient, but maintaining a mask of civility.

Text.Value: I admit, I'm surprised a True Soul does not know this. Where are you headed, exactly?
Reach out with your powers to summon the guide.
Someone pinch me, please. I'd really love to wake up from this nightmare.
Now that's what I call an abdomen.
*Your innate arcana roils and reaches - and it makes a connection. Something notices you.*
Gods - a drider. I always thought the stories were exaggerated...

EditorData.NodeContext: a little horrified, a little awestruck

Text.Value: *Your silent greeting hangs in the air a moment, unanswered. Then, from the dark...*
You will not get far without a guide. The darkness here is murderous.
Perhaps using the lyre would be the wisest course.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gentling suggesting a correction to someone you respect. Stress on 'would'

Text.Value: Greetings, in the Absolute's name. You have been charged with - guiding us...

EditorData.NodeContext: Formal tone, addressing a respected member of his cult, but the creature isn't listening - it scuttles away to look at something else and he trails off

EditorData.logicalname: LOGIC - Summon drider and start inclusion

Text.Value: Minthara always carried it on her person. I assume she still does.
I fear neither of us are travelling, then. The darkness here is murderous - the only safe way through is with a guide.
Did you bring the lyre?
True Souls don't answer stupid questions.
*Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*
Take your your instrument and play - your music a call. A summons.
I'm travelling to Moonrise, like you.
*Your rage echoes throughout the darkness - and it makes a connection. Something notices you.*
*Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*
To rend the Absolute asunder, and tear apart every false cultist!
I'm here to destroy the Absolute and every last cultist.
By the gods. One of Lolth's abominations.

EditorData.NodeContext: Subtly taken aback - not quite horrified, but unnerved

Text.Value: Just hurry back, we can't wait forever. The darkness is encroaching.
Yes, I hear them, your majesty. Calling us.
*A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*
Take out the lyre and start to play.
I have it right here.
Then pluck a tune and our guide will come scuttling.
No need for the lyre. I'll call this guide myself.
Attack.

Synopsis: Player approaches Kansif (a stoic, honourable male half-orc) and Brawler Vez (a mouthy female goblin) after clearing a checkpoint and entering their camp in the Shadowcurse. They two Absolute cultists assume you're a True Soul sent by Minthara (which may or may not be true) and will ask if you brought the lyre needed to summon their guide through the darkness. If you have, you can play it and the drider will emerge. If you haven't, they can tell you where to find it.
